lines.text: [first lines]
[the train carrying the Deputy Sheriff and his prisoner, Jim Larsen, pulls into the depot at Porter]
We'll be in Porter for a few minutes. Want some air, Jim?
Why don't you get off without me?
I'd be lonely.
Mister, you're butting into something that doesn't concern you. Either you're extra good with that gun, or you're bluffing.
All you gotta do is figure out which it is.
I never did thank you. If it wasn't for you, I wouldn't have gotten married.
As long as you're thankin' me and not blamin' me, you're welcome.
You look different... bigger.
Well, maybe it's the gun. It would make anyone look bigger.
Riley, if I have to kill you, I don't much care whether it's tomorrow or now. You can save us both time by starting the trouble now.
Are you trying to tell me I should ask her to marry me now? Tonight?
That's what I'm trying to tell you.
Don't you realize that I might be killed in the morning?
Anybody can be killed... any day.
Anybody is me! Any day is tomorrow!
Now, no one is as important enough to walk wherever he wants. He's bound to run into something that will stop him.
Why didn't you leave tonight, Ray?
Oh, I just couldn't seem to get started.
I've heard men say that the first part of the journey is often the hardest.
Yeah, I guess it is.
Why is that?
Oh, I don't know... different reasons.
Is it ever because you're afraid to start out from one place to another... to try something different... even if it's bad?
